meanings.definition: Thanatologists: experts in the study of death and dying.
meanings.sent1: The thanatologists conducted research on different cultural beliefs about death.
meanings.sent2: The thanatologists presented their findings at the conference on end-of-life care.
meanings.sent3: The thanatologists joked that their job was to make death less scary.
meanings.sent4: In a world without thanatologists, our understanding of mortality would be dim.
meanings.sent5: The thanatologists' dedication to their work was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: Thanatologists: those who specialize in the field of death studies.
meanings.sent1: Many thanatologists work in hospices to support patients and families.
meanings.sent2: The thanatologists' conference brought together experts from various disciplines.
meanings.sent3: The thanatologists shared stories of unusual requests they received from clients.
meanings.sent4: The role of thanatologists is crucial in helping society cope with loss.
meanings.sent5: The thanatologists' passion for their work was evident in every conversation.
